intro: Hepetis claussenii, commonly known as the California larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are palmately compound, with multiple leaflets arranged radiating from a central point. Hepetis claussenii is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
